review_title: Great place to start your IT Support career but very hard to move up at FB
pros: - Telling people you work at Facebook gives you immediate report and oddly almost celebrity status - You get to work with the most educated and motivated people in the world. - Global company so offices everywhere and constantly expanding - This role has a good work life balance because you never have to bring your work home with you. You work 8-5 - This role allows you to interact with anyone and everyone at the company. - Open culture and internal systems. Very accepting of different lifestyles and perspectives. - NO DRESS CODE (wear yoga pants to work or PJ pants if you want) - Free food breakfast lunch and dinner plus snack and drinks always available. - MPK (Menlo Park) is Facebooks Headquarters and has so many different amenities like on site gyms, ice cream, coffee shops and it’s all free. Except for certain on campus coffee shops like Philz, Verve, Blue Bottle. - Free Purple Tie dry cleaning or wash/fold laundry service on campus - You can request reimbursement for up to $720 per year for healthy lifestyle related expenses like massages, ski lift tickets, meditation apps/service fees like FitBit premium, HeadSpace etc. They even opened it up to use for the purchase of fitness equipment like the Apple Watch, barbells, and most things fitness related. - $75 per month can be reimbursed for home internet during covid wfh Hardware Perks: - Facebook FTEs (Full Time Employees) always get the latest hardware when you start. - Upgrade your laptop and phone every 2yrs - Unlimited data and tethering for your work phone with an option to port your personal number and use it for work and personal for free. - If you want any special paid software for work it’s easy to request and get it approved. - When offices open again there are IT Equipment Vending Machines full of free accessories like chargers/cables/adapters/mice
cons: - You work 8-5 minus a 1hr scheduled lunch. - You are considered a shift worker so every hour on the clock is scheduled for a particular support queue. (Live chat, phones, tickets, project work etc.) - VERY HIGH VOLUME! This job will keep you very busy! - The expectations are very high compared to most entry level “Helpdesk” style jobs. You’re currently expected to resolve at least 3 tickets per hour during covid wfh just to meet the minimum expectations. This sounds easy but try doing it 8hrs per day everyday while dealing with wfh and other challenges while remote. - This role hires IC (Individual Contributor) levels (2, 3, or 4) FB likes to put you at the lowest level they can. If you have 5-7yrs+ of industry experience you should be an IC4 or 5 in most other roles but this one will likely offer you IC2 or 3 but you should push for IC4. - You must be an IC 4 before you can even apply for any people manager or team lead roles. It’s very hard to get promoted to a new level in this role because your time is fully spent in core support work but promotions can only happen if you also find time to discover and drive cross functional global impact that you can measure with data. You must do this whole also maintaining your core workload which can be very difficult.

review_title: Graduates and early in careers - don't come here.
pros: Smooth transition to working from home -- They offered COVID emergency leave --- Option to avail of Alternative Work Arrangements during the Pandemic from different countries
cons: Management in the GBG Scaled team in Dublin aren't going to focus on your personal development or take into account your desired career trajectory. It's unfortunate as they hired me as a graduate in 2017 at a time when the company was expanding greatly. They did so with the promise of a fulfilling career (it wasn't) and a clear path to progression. Fast forward nearly three years and unfortunately, their support for graduates has gone out the window to be replaced by a preference for Agency or 'Industry' hires who, despite my longer tenure, come in at a higher IC level. Now arguably, I can see people seeing the value in this. And to an extent so can I. However Management (I'm thinking of my manager and her director here) have managed to get into their positions through the 'rising tide' effect. Meaning, they happened to be at FB at the right place and at the right time. So their seniority or job title doesn't match their ability to lead or nurture their team. It's stressful as we face Agencies a lot of the time and given that Management are very focused on pursuing their own projects and building their own personal brands and connections (we have an internal review process called a PSC), they are not incentivized to genuinely look for and nurture our careers. They ignored the Tiktok threat and disregarded them until 4 people from our team were poached, and still their was no action on their part. Unfortunately, the final straw for me was when I felt that my role didn't match my job title. A partner Manager is supposed to consult and focus on Business Development but Management have us doing support tasks and personal favors for their friends in the industry. Any time I pushed back, It reflected on my performance review which encouraged me to pick up the phone (metaphorically speaking) and take up a job with Tiktok in a completely different country!
